Installing MATSS on the HiPerGator

Source: vignettes/hipergator-install.Rmd
hipergator-install.Rmd

  1. Log onto HiPerGator

    ssh username@hpg2.rc.ufl.edu

  2. Follow the installation instructions for Python on HiPerGator. No need to actually install packages yet.

  3. Create a file named .Rprofile to allow for local installs

    echo '.libPaths(c("/home/USERNAME/R_libs", .libPaths()))' >> .Rprofile

  4. Load and open the R module (this loads R for use)

    ml R
R

  5. In R install the core Python retriever (yes, this happens in R, which is kind of magical).

    install.packages('reticulate')
library(reticulate)
conda_install('r-reticulate', 'retriever')
devtools::install_github('ropensci/rdataretriever')

  6. Restart R

  7. Install the rdataretriever

    devtools::install_github('ropensci/rdataretriever')
library(rdataretriever)

  8. Install MATSS

    devtools::install_github("weecology/MATSS")

  9. To run a MATSS pipeline on HiPerGator you will need to setup drake to use slurm for parallel scheduling. See https://github.com/weecology/MATSS-LDATS/ for an example of how to do this.

Developed by Hao Ye, Ellen Bledsoe, Erica Christensen, Renata Diaz, Juniper Simonis, S. K. Morgan Ernest, Ethan White, Glenda Yenni.
